Fasting lab test results include: Total cholesterol 120; HDL cholesterol 58; Triglycerides 148; Blood sugar 102; and C-reactive protein (CRP) 4.2. The health care provider informs the patient that she will be started on a statin medication and aspirin. The client asks the nurse why she needs to take these medications. The best response is:

options.A: The medications are not indicated since your lab values are all normal.
options.B: The triglycerides are elevated and will not return to normal without these medications.
options.C: The labs indicate severe hyperlipidemia and the medications will lower your LDL, along with a low fat diet.
options.D: The CRP is elevated indicating inflammation seen in cardiovascular disease, which can be lowered by the medications ordered.

question: After discussing asthma as a chronic condition, one of the following statements by the father of a child with asthma best reflects the family's adjustment to this aspect of the child's disease:

options.C: We keep our child away from other children to help cut down on infections.
options.D: We try to keep him happy at all costs; otherwise, he has an asthma attack.
